oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sortenbedingte Unterschiede der N-Effizienz und Beziehung zum Wurzelwachstums von Weizen (Triticum aestivum L.) unter den Bedingungen des Ökologischen Landbaus
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Baresel, J P
Reents, H J
Zimmermann, G
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Cereals, pulses and oilseeds
Breeding, genetics and propagation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: N Uptake at EC 32, 62 and 92 was determined in 6 wheat varieties in field trials under conditions of conventional and organic farming over 3 years. Root growth potential was assessed in a separate trial under controlled conditions. Rank of varieties regarding N-uptake was dependent on yield level of the test environments and was mainly due to differences in uptake during grain filling. In one variety high N uptake potential coincided with high root growth in later growth stages.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Baresel, J P; Reents, H J and Zimmermann, G (2005) Sortenbedingte Unterschiede der N-Effizienz und Beziehung zum Wurzelwachstums von Weizen (Triticum aestivum L.) unter den Bedingungen des Ökologischen Landbaus. [N-efficiency and root growth of wheat (Triticum aestivum L.) varieties under conditions of organic farming.] In: Heß, J and Rahmann, G (Eds.) Ende der Nische, Beiträge zur 8. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, kassel university press GmbH, Kassel.
